Authors:
Ruben De Lange, Slavomir Adamcik, Katarina Adamcikova,
Pieter Asselman, Lynn Delgat, Felix Hampe, Annemieke Verbeken
Title:
Enlightening the black and white: the Russula albonigra
species complex unravelled.
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Ectomycorrhizal fungi, Phylogeny,
Russulales, Russula subg. Compactae, Taxonomy, Typification, 4 New
taxa
Abstract:
Russula albonigra is a well-known species delimited by the
context of the basidiomata that is blackening without reddening and the
menthol-cooling taste of the lamellae. The species has a broad
ecological amplitude and a large distribution area. A thorough molecular
analysis based on four nuclear markers (ITS, LSU, RPB2 and TEF1-Î±) shows
R. albonigra s.l. represents a species complex consisting of at least
five European species and three North-American species. A morphological
study shows traditional characters used to delimit R. albonigra are not
always reliable and a new delimitation of the R. albonigra lineage is
proposed and a key to the species of R. subg. Compactae is presented. An
epitype is designated for R. albonigra and four new European species are
described: R. ambusta, R. nigrifacta, R. sardoa and R. ustulata.
